intro: Zygophyllum qatarense, commonly known as the Qatar date bush, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and efficient water conservation mechanisms. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Zygophyllum qatarense plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
